definition: needless repetition of an idea, statement, or word
examples: Rhetorical repetition, tautology ('always and for ever'), banal metaphor, and short paragraphs are part of the jargon.
The phrase "a beginner who has just started" is a tautology.

definition: a statement that is true by virtue of its logical form alone
examples: A logical combination of sentences that is always true, regardless of the truth or falsity of the constituent sentences, is known as a "tautology."
… now the objection was raised that the entire theory of natural selection rested on a tautology: "Who survives? The fittest. Who are the fittest? Those that survive."
